title: How should I study high-school level philosophy for an International Olympiad even though my school does not teach it? - Quora

response.answer_text: Try to find previous participants - in your home country. Would you be the first to enter the Olympiad from your country - if not, contact previous participants and ask them your question. Their advice would be the voice of experience - what would they recommend to you? Google the name of your home country and 'philosophy clubs' and also 'philosophy teachers' - write a philosophy professor at the university nearest to your home and ask the question of that professor - the Internet should be able to help you find proper contacts - people who are familiar with the Olympiad to whom you can pose your question.
